sep.gaia.renderer.layer

Class TileLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.renderer.layer.AbstractLayer
      • sep.gaia.renderer.layer.TileLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DrawableLayer

    public class TileLayer
extends AbstractLayer
    The TileLayer is the first layer that is drawn in GAIA. It draws the 2d tiles. All other DrawableLayer implementations are rendered after this first initial layer.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer, Matthias Fisch

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(javax.media.opengl.GL2 gl,
        float height)
        Draws all tiles available for the current view. Also all OpenGL-specific work in the adapter must be performed here. To accomplish this performGLCalls() is called.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface DrawableLayer
        Specified by:
        draw in class AbstractLayer
        Parameters:
        gl - The GL context in which the layers renders its content.
        height - The logical height of this layer. If a layer l2 should be drawn over l1, that are drawn via l1.draw(gl, h1) and l2.draw(gl, h2) respectively, then h2 must be greater than h1.
